content: @WG-async-foundations Meeting in 5 minutes

Agenda for today:

  • [tmandry] Call for announcements / updates
  • [nikomataskis] Update on vision doc
  • [tmandry] New issue triage
By the way, I'd like to add members to the hackmd space, so they can add agenda items
Or maybe the best way is to do a call for items the day before :thinking:
@WG-async-foundations Okay, time for our meeting
Any announcements / updates?

small update: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/83205 may make it so we can implement the best version of Stream::next (provided method on the trait and not an extension trait, and callable from a &mut dyn Stream)
interesting
Not an announcement, but a :wave:. I'm hoping to spend a bit more time in async land. I've been having fun helping Niko with the vision doc this week.
One thing that @Bhargav Voleti brought up is that the must_not_suspend lint RFC hasn't actually merged
@nikomatsakis Is that something you can hit the button on?
I guess the same is true for the Stream RFC
Yep, I can do that
I will add to my to do list
Great. Thanks for the announcements everyone.
I don't know if this is going to work or not yet but
@triagebot end-topic
Unknown Zulip user. Please add zulip-id = 116883 to your file in rust-lang/team.
ah, I thought I did that already, but ok
what does that do?
(if it worked)
It solicits reaction emojis to agree to close the topic, or say that we still have more to discuss
I'll just say that if you have any more announcements or updates, speak up now :)
Otherwise, we are going to move to the vision doc update
Okay, let's do that
It also looks like the Stream RFC finished FCP a month ago and could be merged?
vision doc
@Sean McArthur yeah we discussed that above, niko is going to merge it
oops, I only saw mention of must_not_suspend
here is a belated announcement
although it fits in with the vision doc topic
I have noticed some folks publishing blog posts -- and some blog posts that already exist
I just opened rust-lang/wg-async-foundations#61 to collect those links
ah, nice
other than that, the vision doc is :lightning: live :lightning:
one thing I would like to discuss is the "process" around merging PRs etc
what I wanted to propose is that in these meetings we could briefly look at open PRs and decide whether to merge, and I or others can do it after the meeting
I kind of figure we can merge when it "feels done enough", I'd rather we move quickly than iterate to perfection
another thing to discuss is what we can do to prompt more stories, catalog more ideas, or engage folks who don't want to write stories
e.g., in the pasts we had talked a bit about "interviewing" or something, @tmandry ?

is that good for an agenda then?

  • PR triage
  • ideas for helping folks to write stories
yeah, I've talked with some people on the fuchsia side
ok, let's do pr triage first
though making it as "self-serve" as possible seems ideal
add status quo story: first steps into async rust-lang/wg-async-foundations#56
I think this is ready to merge :)
I agree
haven't read it yet and I'm not going to read it all in this meeting, but I'm fine with merging
/me skims the comments
ok. i can merge it, but @rylev (or others who are interested!) we should add you to the repo so we can spread that work around
(the best way to do that is to add you to the wg)
I can add @rylev
Whatever is easiest. I don't want to presume I join the working group just because of a few hours of work ;-)
I consider anyone who is actively involved to be eligible for membership myself :)
it's not like it gets you that much but the ability to be assigned tasks :p
https://media.giphy.com/media/YnBntKOgnUSBkV7bQH/source.mp4
grr, no rendering??
status quo: Alan hates writing a Stream #48
I think @Sean McArthur you still planned to incorporate feedback here?
i'm editing :)
great, we can hold off then
ok, that's it for triage
I suppose we ought to have a process that is not part of this triage meeting for this
so actually now that I thnk about it, maybe we can discuss that :) i would like something pretty lightweight

I'm imagining something like: open a zulip topic to propose that you think something is done, and if @tmandry or I agree, go ahead and merge it? idk. I'm giving us special privileges as leads, but I think the same applies to us, we hvae to find a second person :)
For reviewing PRs? Can we just open topics here in Zulip? Personally if two members of the wg sign off on PRs I'm happy and don't need to be consulted before merging
I would also be ok honestly with just any two people :)
in fact, that's what I was typing first
let's just do that
that seems fine
one question I have is, do you think stories will be able to incorporate other ideas after they're first written?
We can always revise after merging no?

tmandry said:

one question I have is, do you think stories will be able to incorporate other ideas after they're first written?

I think that can happen
I'm also ok with people opening PRs to add things

rylev said:

We can always revise after merging no?

that's another question, does the original author "own" the story or do we
I think we do
sounds good to me
we don't list the "author" on the story
Yes we own though we should try to consult with the author to see if we're changing the original intent - perhaps new stories can come from that.
but also i plan to e.g. open some PRs to add a FAQ on @rylev's story, clarifying the role of pin a bit

rylev said:

Yes we own though we should try to consult with the author to see if we're changing the original intent - perhaps new stories can come from that.

yes we should be polite
it's just that we can expand stories
and include the experiences of multiple people
i definitely wouldn't want to make changes that lose original intent, just add details, or similar experiences
yep, agreed

ok, so resolved;

  • to merge a PR, any member of the wg can open a topic and propose it be merged -- if there is a second, go ahead and do it

ideally there shouldn't be any unresolved concerns etc-- i would say that in the end though the author owns their experience. We should be able to find ways i think though to express factually what they experienced, while avoiding mischaracterization.
maybe @rylev or smeone else, you can open a PR amending the How To Vision doc with this procedure?
like, adding a "For WG members" section or something?
Sure thing!
only other question was about outreach and what we want to do there
after this meeting i had planned to write up something and post it in various communities, as discussed in #wg-async-foundations > async communities to reach out to
i'm also talking to folks in AWS and planning to engage some of the "engineers in the trenches" to collect facts and stories
I don't know yet if they will want to write them directly (ideal) or if i will summarize
i'm curious about other folks' ideas, and also whether we want to do anything else to invite or arrange interviews etc?
(I am also reaching out to folks inside of Microsoft )
(one thought: we could do tweets calling attention to particular open issues)
for the purpose of getting people to write stories about them? or contribute to the issues? both I guess?
I meant more the former
yeah, makes sense to me
sort of... "Would you like to contribute to the async vision doc? This issue has lots of juicy details, maybe write about that? "
Ah I'd be happy to tweet about this
same
worth a try :)
we can coordinate on zulip so we don't all tweet the same issue :)

the only other thing is if we wanted to try and do some kind of "let us interview you" effort. I'm...sort of inclined not to do that except ad hoc right now. I think mostly because I don't quite know how to organize it and we're already doing quite a lot.
I think we talked about it before though, and I sort of recall @tmandry you sayng something about it :)
I guess I'd rather focus on getting more people directly involved, and for those folks with less inclination, encourage them to comment on issues
yeah, that was when I was optimistic about the amount of time I would have :p
ok, let's drop it then :)
I think issues fills the gap
yeah I think issues are good
or pointing to existing blog posts
(I'm wondering if individual blog posts warrant their own issues actually)

tmandry said:

(I'm wondering if individual blog posts warrant their own issues actually)

I almost went an opened an issue per blog post exccept
I thoght that a single blog post likely had multiple stories embedded in it
so I wanted to take the time to read the post and tease out what those might be
so the meta blog post issue is like an issue pipeline :)
(and e.g. the blog post might be evidence for an existing issue)
yeah, I should write that up more clearly
Once we get more stories we might notice more overlap. If story C has the same content as story A and B combined and told differently, do we still want story C?
I was thinking we'd have to summarize the points the post makes on the issue

rylev said:

Once we get more stories we might notice more overlap. If story C has the same content as story A and B combined and told differently, do we still want story C?

my opinion is, if somebody writes it, I want to merge it, but I wouldn't encourage people to write up a fresh story if it's already covered, I'd rather they expand an existing story
yeah, that sounds reasonable to me
ok. i guess I'm done with async vision doc topics, except maybe one small note
actually two, one of which is maybe less small

• it was pointed out to me that the award categories (particularly with voting) might favor native speakers a bit too much, and/or become a popularity contest. I was thinking of adjusting things to (a) maybe give an award for all folks who are new to contributing to rust and (b) to be a bit less tied to 'writing quality'
open to suggestions:)

• I've been puzzling over the tenets. I want to take a stab at a second draft. I'm not sure the best way to solicit feedback etc on those, but I guess I plan to post them here first, circulate them with various people as well 1:1, and then open a PR and take feedback that way
now I am truly done

I've been puzzling over the tenets.

Can you explain more. I might be missing context.
Oh, it's just that I want to revise the async design tenets
you see they are listed as "draft"
I think they can be improved
(though I expect most of what is in there will remain in some form or another)

nikomatsakis said:

  • it was pointed out to me that the award categories (particularly with voting) might favor native speakers a bit too much, and/or become a popularity contest. I was thinking of adjusting things to (a) maybe give an award for all folks who are new to contributing to rust and (b) to be a bit less tied to 'writing quality'

I would be in favor of ditching anything tied to how well someone writes.
"Award categories" means the thumbs ups and hearts on github issues?
I like having a draft up for framing conversation, but I still think of the final tenets as being "downstream" of the status quo stuff
https://rust-lang.github.io/wg-async-foundations/vision/how_to_vision/awards.html

tmandry said:

I like having a draft up for framing conversation, but I still think of the final tenets as being "downstream" of the status quo stuff

yeah, I do too, ultimately

rylev said:

I would be in favor of ditching anything tied to how well someone writes.

they weren't meant to be, but I guess "most humorous' or "most creative" could turn out that way
still, I'm more inclined to add awards than take things away
one thing is that we didn't have the idea of issues when I drafted those categories
maybe we can come up with something on that
no rush on this :)
we have 6 weeks
@tmandry should we move to issue triage?

Andrew Chin said:

"Award categories" means the thumbs ups and hearts on github issues?

it's referring to this page
(er, yes, @Andrew Chin I was trying to point that to you with the link above but maybe that wasn't clear :)
oh, I also missed that you posted that :)
i got it, thank you :) (sorry for the intrusion)
please. I was so excited to see someone besides @tmandry and @rylev say something!
same :)
(and me, of course)
Okay, let's do a triagebot-like thing here
Respond with :thumbs_up: if you're ready to move on, and with :sparkler: if you have more to say on the vision doc topic
sorry, if i may ask 1 quick question:
would you prefer new topics for discussion (like a proposal for a new story, or new project, or something) to be brought up via github issues, or zulip threads?
a very good question. I think i'd prefer github issues.
though I'm not opposed to both :)
I'd say issue and then open a thread and link to the issue if you'd like to discuss in more depth
but I think issues will get more eyes, and it's easier to get a list of them
i guess github issues might get more eyes, and would be better for people who are not in the same timezone as the original creator
okay, I think we can move on then
Issue triage
There's only one new issue, but because of the Github outage last week I need to remember what we decided for those two issues
starting with those
Nested async closures result in exponential compilation time increase #83031
I don't think we decided to put this on deck
I don't think so either but I guess I could browse the past messages
marking triaged
Async fn disagrees on its own return type ("one of the expected opaque types" vs "one of the found opaque types") #82921
we said on deck
I guess we never decided whether this was a duplicate of #79648
which is already on deck
oh yeah, chat history :)
okay
done
ICE with async_trait #82470
on deck, of course
yeah
the mcve is pretty bad :)
yeah
wondering if it's a regression or not
but this seems like a pretty high priority
okay, that's all the issues
I think we can end the meeting early?
React with :thumbs_up: if you agree, :sparkler: if you have any other topics to discuss :)
Okay, I think that means we can wrap up
Thanks everyone, have a great day :wave:

@tmandry btw we have automation for the meeting ending:

@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
